conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in School_C.

At a high level, we can extend an offer to the next eligible applicant only when (1) we still have an open seat and (2) there are no higher-priority students actively under consideration for that seat (i.e., no higher-priority applicant is in a position to take the seat at that moment). Because we must allocate our remaining seat in line with our priority order, we are not able to set a guaranteed trigger point by round or date.

That said, if your situation changes (for example, you receive decisions elsewhere or your top choices narrow), you’re welcome to message us with an update confirming you remain ready to enroll immediately if offered a place. While it won’t override our priority order, it helps us understand who is prepared to move quickly should the seat become available to them.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for the clear update—especially confirming that you are not holding another offer and that you can accept and complete enrollment immediately.

At a high level, for School_C to extend an offer to the next eligible applicant under our priority order in any given round, all of the following would need to be true at that moment:

1) We still have an open seat (we do).
2) There is no higher-priority student (relative to you on our list) who is currently in a position to take the seat in that round—e.g., a higher-priority student is actively applying to us, is in active conversation indicating they are about to apply, or becomes available to accept during that round.
3) We receive (or can act on) a formal application when the above conditions hold, since offers are only made in response to an [APPLY].

Because students can change targets round-to-round, we can’t reliably forecast when condition (2) will be satisfied. The most helpful things you can continue to do are exactly what you did here: confirm you remain able to accept immediately, and let us know if any decision deadlines arise for you.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
